segments.speaker: receptionist
segments.text: Good morning, Riverside Swimming Centre. This is Sarah speaking. How can I help you?

segments.speaker: customer
segments.text: Oh hello. I'm calling about swimming lessons for my daughter. I saw your advertisement in the local newspaper.

segments.speaker: receptionist
segments.text: Certainly! I'd be happy to help you with that. Could I start by taking some details? What's your daughter's name, please?

segments.speaker: customer
segments.text: It's Emma. That's E-M-M-A. And her surname is Johnson, J-O-H-N-S-O-N.

segments.speaker: receptionist
segments.text: Thank you. And how old is Emma?

segments.speaker: customer
segments.text: She's eight years old. She'll be nine next month, but she's eight now.

segments.speaker: receptionist
segments.text: Right, so she'll be in our junior group then. And what's your contact number in case we need to reach you?

segments.speaker: customer
segments.text: It's oh seven nine five six, four eight three seven two nine. That's my mobile number.

segments.speaker: receptionist
segments.text: Let me just confirm that. Oh seven nine five six four eight three seven two nine. Perfect. And could I have your address please?

segments.speaker: customer
segments.text: Yes, we live at forty-five Park Avenue. That's in Millfield.

segments.speaker: receptionist
segments.text: Park Avenue in Millfield. And what's the postcode?

segments.speaker: customer
segments.text: M F three, seven R Q.

segments.speaker: receptionist
segments.text: Excellent. Now, what's Emma's current swimming level? Has she had any lessons before?

segments.speaker: customer
segments.text: Well, she can swim a little bit. She can do basic front crawl for about ten metres, but her technique isn't very good. I'd say she's a beginner really.

segments.speaker: receptionist
segments.text: That sounds like our Level Two class would be perfect for her. Level One is for complete beginners who can't swim at all, and Level Two focuses on improving basic strokes.

segments.speaker: customer
segments.text: That sounds ideal. When are the classes held?

segments.speaker: receptionist
segments.text: We have several options. There's a Wednesday evening class at half past six, a Saturday morning class at ten o'clock, and a Sunday afternoon class at quarter past two.

segments.speaker: customer
segments.text: The Saturday morning sounds good. What time does it finish?

segments.speaker: receptionist
segments.text: The Saturday class runs from ten o'clock to eleven o'clock, so it's a one-hour session.

segments.speaker: customer
segments.text: Perfect. And how much does it cost?

segments.speaker: receptionist
segments.text: The lessons are fifteen pounds per session, or you can buy a block of eight lessons for one hundred and ten pounds. That works out slightly cheaper.

segments.speaker: customer
segments.text: I think I'll start with the block of eight lessons then. When can she start?

segments.speaker: receptionist
segments.text: The next course starts this Saturday, the sixteenth of March. Would that suit you?

segments.speaker: customer
segments.text: Yes, that's fine. What should she bring?

segments.speaker: receptionist
segments.text: She'll need a swimming costume, towel, and goggles. We also recommend bringing a water bottle. Oh, and parents aren't allowed in the pool area during lessons for safety reasons, but you can watch from the viewing gallery.

segments.speaker: customer
segments.text: That's understandable. Is there parking available?

segments.speaker: receptionist
segments.text: Yes, we have a car park right next to the building. It's free for customers.

segments.speaker: receptionist
segments.text: Right, let me just confirm the booking. That's Emma Johnson, aged eight, Level Two swimming lessons, Saturday mornings at ten o'clock, starting March sixteenth, block of eight lessons for one hundred and ten pounds. Is that correct?

segments.speaker: customer
segments.text: Yes, that's perfect.

segments.speaker: receptionist
segments.text: Great! How would you like to pay? We accept cash, card, or bank transfer.

segments.speaker: customer
segments.text: I'll pay by card when I come in on Saturday.

segments.speaker: receptionist
segments.text: That's fine. Just arrive about fifteen minutes early on Saturday for Emma to get changed. The changing rooms are on the ground floor.

segments.speaker: customer
segments.text: Wonderful. Is there anything else I need to know?

segments.speaker: receptionist
segments.text: Just that if Emma misses a lesson, we can arrange a makeup session, but you need to give us at least twenty-four hours notice. And if you have any questions, just give us a call.

segments.speaker: customer
segments.text: That's great. Thank you so much for your help, Sarah.

segments.speaker: receptionist
segments.text: You're very welcome! We look forward to seeing Emma on Saturday. Have a lovely day!

segments.speaker: customer
segments.text: Thank you. Goodbye!

segments.speaker: receptionist
segments.text: Goodbye!
